docs.lead_paragraph: LAS VEGAS -- Forget about the cholesterol-counting mob heirs to Bugsy Siegel or shy casino kings like Steve Wynn and their $5,000-a-night rooms. The real power in Vegas is centered in a schlub of a building next to razor-wire-enclosed repo lots in the shadow of the glitzy Strip.
docs.abstract: With its powerful union base and recession-proof service industry, Nevada has emerged as a state with political clout.
docs.snippet: With its powerful union base and recession-proof service industry, Nevada has emerged as a state with political clout.

docs.lead_paragraph: Updated, 2:41 p.m. | Judging from excerpts released this morning, Gov. Eliot Spitzer's second State of the State address this afternoon will strike a conciliatory tone and focus heavily on meat-and-potato issues like schools, property taxes and health insurance as he seeks to regain his political footing, turn attention away from the multiple and potentially crippling ethics investigations he still faces, and build the foundation for his second year in office.Such a speech would not be so different from Mr. Spitzer's first such address a year ago, despite the decline in the governor's fortunes since then. Mr. Spitzer's first state of the state address mixed broad reform proposals unpopular with Albany lawmakers (campaign finance reform and non-partisan redistricting) with a large platter of proposals that offered something for everyone, whether more education spending for Democrats or worker's compensation reform for Republicans.

headline.main: An Advance Look at Spitzer's Speech

docs.abstract: Gov. Eliot Spitzer is expected to strike a conciliatory tone in his second state of the state speech this afternoon, focusing heavily on issues like schools, property taxes and health insurance, based on excerpts released this morning.
docs.snippet: Gov. Eliot Spitzer is expected to strike a conciliatory tone in his second state of the state speech this afternoon, focusing heavily on issues like schools, property taxes and health insurance, based on excerpts released this morning.

docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. Eliot Spitzer kicked off his second year with warm words for his friends and foes alike, offering a less combative tone in his State of the State address.
docs.snippet: Gov. Eliot Spitzer kicked off his second year with warm words for his friends and foes alike, offering a less combative tone in his State of the State address.

docs.lead_paragraph: John McCain’s economic platform contrasts sharply with his rivals’ and represents the start of a Republican response to middle-class anxiety.
